Pre-Game Insights: Coach Walid Rikraki is planning to make significant changes to the Moroccan national team's lineup for their upcoming match against Congo in the 2026 World Cup qualifiers.
The changes are aimed at improving the team's performance and ensuring a win in this crucial match.
Midfield Reshuffle: Sofiane Amrabet will return to his position in the defensive midfield, after missing Fridayâ€™s game due to a suspension.
Defence Changes: Chadi Riad, a young defender who has impressed for Real Betis in La Liga, is expected to be introduced into the starting line-up.
Nayef Akrad has returned from injury, but Rikraki is still deciding between him and Ghanem Saiss to make the best decision on the starting line-up.
Forward Line Changes: Youssef Nasiri is expected to be put on the bench after expressing his anger in the previous match against Zambia after being substituted early in the second half.
Ayoub El Kaabi is expected to start in the upcoming match, capitalizing on his speed and goal-scoring ability.
Sofiane Rahimi remains a second option for the attack, as he has high individual skills and the ability to create goalscoring opportunities.
Others: The changes are part of an overall strategy aimed at improving the team's performance and securing qualification for the 2026 World Cup.

The new changes require time for coordination and understanding between the players to ensure optimal performance in the match.
